data.text: What is a U.S. Visa Number?

The U.S. visa number is a unique set of numbers printed in red on your visa. This number is located at the bottom right of the visa and is very important for the immigration process. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) officers use this number to verify the information on your visa.

Regardless of the type of visa you have, all visa numbers are the same. They don't follow a specific pattern, and each time the number is scanned, a record is created in the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) database. This information is only used to check your immigration status.
Where Can I Find My Visa Number?

Your visa number is located at the bottom right corner of the document. However, sometimes it might be placed elsewhere on the document. In addition to the number, your visa also includes information like the issuing port's name, your full name, gender, date of birth, nationality, passport number, visa type, allowed entries, and important dates like the issue and expiration date.

The number is printed in red and typically consists of 8 digits. In some instances, it might include a letter followed by 7 digits. Each number is unique for each document and doesn't follow any specific pattern.
How to Obtain a U.S. Visa Number
To get a visa number, you must first apply for and receive a U.S. visa. Here's how you do it:

items: Complete and submit the [DS-160 or DS-260 form](/immigration-resources/form-ds-160-explained). This is the first step to apply for a visa.

Pay the [visa application fee](https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/us-visas/visa-information-resources/fees/fees-visa-services.html^). This is a fee you need to pay for your application to be processed.
Schedule a [visa interview](/immigration-resources/us-visa-interview-process). This is a meeting with a consular officer to discuss your application.

Gather and submit the [required documents](https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/us-visas/tourism-visit/visitor.html^). These might include your passport, recent photos, proof of your income, and more.

data.text: Once your visa is approved, it will be sent to you via a courier service. Your visa number will be printed in red on the document.
You don't need to do anything special to get an American visa number. Immigration authorities automatically assign a number to each new visa.
Remember, to get a visa number, you must follow all the steps and meet all the requirements to apply for an American visa.

data.title: Note:
data.message: Avoid using this method just for lulz. It can be very dangerous opposite your daily fun stuff.
